params.taskDescription:
Write the conditional statement, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>p</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">→<!-- → --></mo>
  <mi>q</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">p \to q</annotation></semantics></math>, in words.
params.detailedSolution: If Elvis Presley wore capes, then some superheroes wear capes.

params.taskDescription:
Write the converse statement, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>q</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">→<!-- → --></mo>
  <mi>p</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">q \to p</annotation></semantics></math>, in words.
params.detailedSolution: If some superheroes wear capes, then Elvis Presley wore capes.

params.taskDescription:
Write the inverse statement, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mi>p</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">→<!-- → --></mo>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">

    </mrow>
  </mrow>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mi>q</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\text{~}p \to {\rm{ }}\text{~}q</annotation></semantics></math>, in words.
params.detailedSolution: If Elvis Presley did not wear capes, then no superheroes wear capes.

params.taskDescription:
Write the contrapositive statement, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mi>q</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">→<!-- → --></mo>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">

    </mrow>
  </mrow>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mi>p</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\text{~}q \to {\rm{ }}\text{~}p</annotation></semantics></math>, in words.
params.detailedSolution: If no superheroes wear capes, then Elvis Presley did not wear capes.

questionSetStimulus:
Use the statements, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>p</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">p</annotation></semantics></math>: Elvis Presley wore capes and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>q</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">q</annotation></semantics></math>: Some superheroes wear capes, to write the following statements:
